Espera seguir trabajando en la tierras para seguir manteniendo a su familia, el préstamo le va ayudar porque con eso espera obtener mayor producción y generar más ganancias y con eso comprar lo básico para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Ismael is 63 years old. He finished the second grade, and for about five years, he took classes at night. Ismael is married with one son, age 18. His wife is a homemaker, and his son works in agriculture. Ismael says that he has to provide for his wife and son.

Ismael has worked in agriculture since he was ten years old. He learned to farm from his father, who used to bring him along to help with the oxen, the plough and planting crops, especially corn and beans. Ismael has 7,000 square meters of corn planted and 3,5000 square meters of beans. He also grows yucca on a plot of land by his home. Ismael says that he walks about ten minutes to reach his fields, and that he works from six to ten in the morning, and returns in the afternoon to keep an eye on the crops. 
Additionally, Ismael buys a few baby chicks, which he later sells when they are fully grown to make money. 

Ismael is requesting this loan, which he says he needs urgently, to buy agricultural supplies to control infestations in his crops. He will use it to buy fertilizer and pesticides against maggots and flies, as well as leaf pesticide for his beans, which are infected with a fungus that is burning the leaves.  Ismael says that the loan will help his entire family, because he does not have the money to buy what he needs.

Ismael hopes to continue working in the fields to provide for his family. He says that the loan will help him to have a larger harvest, which will increase his income so that he can pay for his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to control infestations in his crops.

loans.name: Abdusamad

texts.ru: Абдусамаду 19 лет. Он студент 1 курса Экономического Университета Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности таможенное дело. Абдусамад учится хорошо и отлично. Он помогает своим однокурсникам. Абдусамад имеет много друзей, и все его друзья дорожат его дружбой. Абдусамад после окончания университета мечтает быть хорошим специалистом своего дела. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор и с такой целью он запрашивает займ. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Abdusamad is 19 years old and a first year student at the Economics University of Tajikistan.  He is majoring in customs and tariffs.  Abdusamad's grades are all A's and B's and he helps his fellow students.  Abdusamad has many friends and all of them value his friendship.  It's Abdusamad's dream to be one day an excellent specialist in his field.   He must pay his tuition and, for this purpose, he is requesting a loan.  He is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for his education at the university

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Chona has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Chona has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia, 57 years of age, is married and blessed with four children. She owns and operates a vegetable vending business for almost 19 years, and she's earning a net income of PHP 400 daily.

Due to financial constraints, she decided to avail a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase string beans, squash, eggplant, bitter gourd, and root crops to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve and earn more income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase string beans, squash, eggplants, bitter gourd, and root crops to sell.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Dolores is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through the past eleven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle.

loans.name: Shynarkul

texts.ru: Шынаркул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Шынаркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Шынаркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с покупки скота на 800 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Шынаркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 нетель, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Шынаркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Шынаркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомашины.
texts.en:
Shynarkul is 51 years old, married, and she and her husband are raising five children.  Shynarkul has a secondary level education.  Her family's main source of income is Shynarkul's animal husbandry business, which she started 33 years ago with a purchase of 800 somi (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Shynarkul has 1 milking cow, 1 calf, 1 heifer, and 10 sheep.  Her monthly income amounts to 16,000 somi (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Shynarkul applied to microfinance bank Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 somi (KGS) to buy a horse.  Shynarkul plans to invest the income from the loan in acquiring more cattle and to save money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Rozia

texts.en:
Rozia, age 30, is a mother of three children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. 

For that reason his wife Rozia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.  He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials like threads, cloth, buttons, ribbons etc. Rozia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine and a variety of threads, cloth, buttons, ribbons etc

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, tiene 45 años, vive con sus padres en casa propia, debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos nace la idea de establecer una tienda, es así como desde hace un año cuenta con su negocio que atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta 7:00 p.m., no se le dificulta atender su tienda por que está ubicada en su casa. Con el crédito que solicita comprara productos de la canasta básica (arroz, frijoles, aceite, etc.).
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para generar los ingresos necesarios que le ayuden a mejorar su casa, brindarles mejor alimentación a su familia y que sus padres tenga acceso a una mejor salud.
texts.en:
Pedro is 45 years old, and lives with his parents in their own home. Pedro needed to increase his income, so he came up with the idea to open a store. For the past year, he has worked in his store from 7 in the morning until 7 in the evening. He says he does not have trouble looking after his store because it is located in his house.

Pedro will use this loan to buy everyday household items such as rice, beans and oil. He says that his dream is to expand his business to increase his income, and he hopes to be able to provide better food for his family and better healthcare for his parents.

loans.use: to buy everyday household items such as rice, beans and oil.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is a married woman and has five children who are still attending school. Rizalina has been in the farming business for more than 5 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income. 

Rizalina is asking for a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of the farm, thus augmenting their yield and income. 

In the future, Rizalina hopes of expanding her farm so that it will generate more revenue, necessary for the needs of the family, such as food and payment of the school expenses for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 52 years old and married with six children.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Adelaida aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa works hard to support her family. Ma. Luisa is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.

Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, etc. for her business.

Ma. Luisa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, needles, buttons, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Emperatriz

texts.en:
Ma. Emperatriz is 63 years old and married with five children. Sheis in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Emperatriz requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippino pesos)  loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Ma. Emperatriz has been in pig fattening for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ma. Emperatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies  for her pigs

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina is applying for a loan of $1200 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house, doing car services.  She is making a good income from car services and she wants to buy more stock with the loan and pay  the mechanic who works for her. She is living in a town near by the main road; so many people come to fix their cars. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy  wiring and equipment for car repair

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan is 27 years old and comes from Baku. He studies business administration. He also runs his own business where he works every day. This is his second education; Ruslan finished his first   university degree in 2012. His parents are currently facing a financial crisis which does not allow them to pay his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, he applied for a  loan of 2000 AZN. He is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mariani

texts.en:
Mariani is 58 years old and widowed with four children. Mariani works very hard to provide for them.

Mariani runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Mariani has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, bread, dried fish, cooking oil, sugar and other groceries. 

Mariani would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 63 years old, a married mother of five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Corazon has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like soft drinks, canned good and other items.

Corazon has been in this business for five years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soft drinks, canned good and other items.

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es:
Jasé, está solicitando un nuevo crédito, necesita comprar insumos agropecuarios y ganado para vender. Desde su ultimo crédito sus ingresos son mejores, el negocio es más amplio, tiene más clientes satisfechos.
Para José es satisfactorio saber que su familia tiene lo necesario para cubrir sus necesidades, todos se encuentran saludables, su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual. En este tiempo no se le ha presentado ninguna dificultad familiar o en su negocio que impidan seguir adelante con su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Jose is requesting a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and livestock to sell. He reports that since the previous loan, his income has improved, his business has expanded and he has more satisfied customers. 

Jose says that he feels satisfied knowing that his family is healthy and has what they need. He says that his family is stable and that they have not encountered anything that could make it difficult to move ahead with his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and livestock to sell.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia is a 42-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her family. Her husband has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. Her husband is also assisted by a young boy in purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. Razia is a mother of seven children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing, and health expenses.

Razia wants to grow the business of her husband so she requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, Kiva's field partner, so that her husband could buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan, in her 7th loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in their earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Razia is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy inventory such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 45 years old and a housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a general store which is the only source of income for his family. He delivers a variety of daily usage products to his customers. Presently, he needs an additional capital to add more variety of goods to his store like sugar, rice, noodles, washing soaps and washing powders.

However, due to financial constraints, Farzana's husband finds this difficult.Therefore his wife Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband. With the profit amount Farzana will put aside some savings. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods for their store like sugar, rice, noodles, washing soaps and washing powders.

loans.name: Frederick

texts.en:
Frederick is 34 years old, married and has three children. All are being sent to school. He is a member of an  entertaining band and they usually perform during festivals and sometimes at weddings. He can play almost all types of instruments except for wind instruments. 

Aside from this, Frederick also runs a general store business in their village. His profit from the business is rolled over as additional revolving capital towards his business expansion. However, this is not enough so he is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise and new product offerings for his regular customers and to attract more. Having the desired loan will enable him to buy drinks, bread, detergent soap and much more. He believes that by taking out this loan, he will be able to satisfy his customers' needs and requested items.

loans.use: to buy more  merchandise and new product offerings like drinks, bread, detergent soap, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 55-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with six grown children.

She is engaged in making palm vinegar. Her business started years 4 ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more empty containers for vinegar storage and for utensils for the household. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability for the improvement of her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy more empty containers for vinegar storage and utensils for the household

loans.name: Maputo Group

texts.en:
Doris, who is in her mid-30s is married with one son who is still going to school. She has been running a business selling fruits, vegetables, sugar, maize flour, beans, baking flour etc. on the same table.

This will be Doris's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she wants to use for buying more fruits, vegetables, sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour and salt. She dreams of owning a retail shop.

Doris will share this loan with her loan group "MAPUTO" with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables, sugar, beans, maize flour, baking flour and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more crafts products from villages to resell in town.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina is 53 years old, married and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Crispina has a business making and selling broomsticks in the Philippines. Crispina requested a PHP 20,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her broomstick business.

Crispina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Crispina would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve her house.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her broomstick business.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en: Melitona works hard to support her family.  She is single and has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.  Melitona requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her stall.  Melitona has been in this business for 4 years now.  In the future, Melitona would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her fruit stall.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Merlinda has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Merlinda has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, solicita nuevamente capital para invertir en la siembra de maíz y frijol, comprara insecticidas, abono, herbicidas, para la preparación de la tierra y aprovechar la época de siembra.
Con el crédito anterior pudo sembrar sin ningún problema, obteniendo una mejor cosecha, sus ingresos fueron mayores con los cuales fortaleció la tienda que tiene en su casa, pago las cuotas del crédito y apoyo más a su familia. Lucha por mantenerse en sus actividades económicas, mejorar el ambiente en que vive.
texts.en: Ana requests a new loan to spend on planting corn and beans.  She will buy insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide to prepare the land and take advantage of the planting season.  With her last loan she was able to plant without any problems and obtained a better harvest.  Her income was higher and she used it to improve the shop she has in her house, make payments on her loan, and support her family more.  Ana strives to support herself with her economic activities and improve the environment she lives in.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and herbicide

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business.  She is married and has four children.  Her husband is a farmer and she has buffaloes, pigs, goats, and chickens.

She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family.  She will use the loan to buy stock items, such as beer, noodles, milk, fish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, and oils.  She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $100.00.  She is a hardworking woman who hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beer, noodles, milk, fish, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, and oils.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 50 years old and widowed with four children.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and works very hard to provide for her family.  She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mercidita has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, soft drinks, biscuits, and school supplies.  In the future Mercidita would like to save money to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. Florencia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Florencia is borrowing PHP 1,800 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency.

Florencia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, she is helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila is a 22-year-old, energetic and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband, and 1 son. Her husband retired from the government and her son works as a tailor in a tailoring shop. Naila is an efficient tailor by profession. Since 2008 she has operated her own tailoring shop. As her husband is a driver, Naila is interested in buying him a taxi to increese his monthly income and to meet the family's monthly expanses. For that reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a taxi for her husband. With the profit amount she will expand her business more by opening one more tailoring shop in the central bazaar. She dreams of living a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. Many thanks and best wishes to all staff of Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en: Shazia is a 39-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a beauty salon, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly net income is insufficient to pay the children's school fees, pay the electricity and gas bills and to meet the daily food needs and other expenses. He has to support his family as well. Presently, he is planning to grow his business. For that Shazia, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of beautician products like lipstick, hair dryers, facial creams and makeup kits to work more professionally. With the amount of profit, he will put aside some savings amount and pay the electricity and gas bills. Shazia hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of cosmetic products for her husband's beauty salon.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 25-year-old married woman who lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband has a business providing transportation services in his auto rickshaw.  He has been doing this work for about 3 years.  

Due to continuous usage and bumps over constructed roads it has minor damages that require maintenance.  But he does not have sufficient funds to fix the problem.  Nazia requested a loan so that her husband would be able to maintain his auto rickshaw.  Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income after repair.  

This will be her first loan with Kiva.  She hopes that with your cooperation her husband will be able to carry out his plans.  She promises to make his payments on time.  Nazia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: to pay for auto rickshaw maintenance.

loans.name: Aninia

texts.en: Aninia is taking out a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as gasoline and diesel. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey lives in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya, which has one of the cooler climates in Kenya.His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops. He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 10 years. 

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling farm produce." His biggest challenge is "Marketing the farm produce." Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Geoffrey was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "They have good loan terms." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "Group co-guarantee members to get a loan."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Geoffrey replied that it will improve their farming and give them more income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Geoffrey owns the following: cow, poultry, but does not own: pigs, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: a TV (used with the car battery), but does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or DVD.

loans.use: To purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Teodula

texts.en:
Teodula works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling sand and gravel in the Philippines.

Teodula requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sand and gravel to sell.

Teodula has been in this business for 10 years now.

Teodula would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and gravel to sell

loans.name: Deodora

texts.en: Deodora is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three grown children. She engages in seaweed farming. She grows and sells seaweed to help augment the income of their household. Her business started more than five years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw to gain more harvest.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business and increase her business profitability to improve her livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope and straw

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 27-year-old married woman. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a beauty salon which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly net income is insufficient to pay for the children's school fees, pay for the electricity and gas bill and to meet the daily food and other expenses. He has to support his family as well. 

Presently, he is planning to grow his business. For that reason, Sumera is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of beautician products like lipstick, hair dryers, facial creams and makeup kits to work more professionally. With the profits, he will put aside some savings and pay for the electricity and gas bill. Sumera hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beautician products like lipstick, hair dryers, facial creams and makeup kits

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is a 36-year-old woman. She lives with her parents in a small village of Sighnaghi district, eastern Georgia. Her parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family has a small vineyard, and they produce wine to sell. 

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, she decided to start a clothing-trading business with the loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Shorena received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  With the loan of GEL 500, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community door-to-door. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Shorena, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The Start Up credit will be a great support for her family, as its income will be significantly increased.

loans.use: to begin selling clothes

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of four-children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. 

From the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Kousar is so much thankful to kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie manages a beauty salon located along their public market in San Manuel. To get additional income, she decided to expand the business into selling cold drinks and food snacks while at the same time managing her salon business. Her services offered in the salon are hair-cutting, hair-curling, and hair-straightening to customers. 

Arcelie wants to borrow PHP 50,000 to buy additional materials/tools needed in the services she offers and to buy various cosmetic products she needs for the business. 

Her utmost dream someday is to have her own business stall so that renting will no longer be a problem to her but will become an idea of offering a stall for rent then if given the chance. She is striving that someday, this dream will be achieved.

loans.use: to buy additional materials/tools for the services she offers and buy various cosmetic products she needs for her business.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support nine children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Conchita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Conchita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money; she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Zenaida is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Zenaida has a sewing business in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fabric, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business.

Zenaida has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric, buttons, zippers, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, opta por otro crédito para invertirlo en compra de abonos, insecticidas y pagar a las personas que le ayudaran a preparar la tierra para la siembra. Ella ve resultados  positivos con el préstamo anterior, tuvo una mejor cosecha (maíz y plátano), tiene mejores ingresos.
Esmeralda cuenta con  el mismo núcleo familiar, las condiciones de vida han cambiado para ella y su familia, están muy saludables y dispuestos a seguir trabajando para lograr construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Esmeralda has decided to request another loan to invest in buying fertilizer and pesticide and paying the people who will help her prepare her land for planting.  She has seen positive results from her previous loan.  She had a better harvest (corn and bananas) and has a higher income.  Esmeralda's family hasn't changed but their living conditions have.  She and her family are very healthy, and are prepared to keep working so they can build their own house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the people who will help her prepare her land

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es:
Julio de 29 años, estudio hasta educación media, tiene cinco años de haberse casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tienen una niña de cuatro años de edad.

Julio es agricultor, cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, también es comerciante y vende productos de primera necesidad, esta actividad la realiza, cuando terminando las labores agrícolas de su cultivo. Ambos oficios los aprendió de su padre, quien fue agricultor y comerciante, y se recuerda que de una edad de 10 años, él acompañaba a su padre al campo y a comercializar los productos que su padre vendía. Julio trabaja de 6 de la mañana a 5 de la tarde. En cuanto al trabajo de siembra recibe ayuda de su esposa, cuando realiza la siembra y recolección del maíz.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar los gastos de estudio para que Julio, pueda estudiar un semestre los días domingos, en una escuela de computación. 


Con el préstamo se estará ayudando a cumplir uno de los sueños de Julio, el cual es estudiar computación. También, desea poseer una computadora en su casa. Ademas, le gustaría estudiar otros idiomas, y lograr superarse en la vida. También desea mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, y mejorar la calidad de vida de el y su familia.
texts.en:
Julio is 29 years old. He studied through high school and has been married for five years. His wife is a homemaker, and they have a four-year-old daughter.

Julio is a farmer. He cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn. He is also a businessman and sells basic needs products; he does this work when he finishes his agricultural work on his farm. He learned both jobs from his father, who was a farmer and businessman. He remembers that from the age of 10 years, he would go with his father to the fields and to sell the products that his father sold. 

Julio works from 6 in the morning to 5 in the afternoon. As for the planting work, he gets help from his wife when he does the sowing and harvesting of the corn. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay for school expenses so that Julio can take classes on Sundays for a semester at a computer school. 

The loan will help to fulfill one of Julio’s dreams, which is to study computers. Also, he hopes to have a computer in his house. In addition, he would like to study other languages and succeed in bettering himself in life. He also wants to improve his house’s infrastructure and improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses so that he can take classes on Sundays for a semester at a computer school.

loans.name: Al-Salam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Salam. It consists of five ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Hania is the leader of this group. She is an illiterate woman who is 32 years old. She is a hardworking woman who loves her family. She said that bad situations forced her to stop her studies in order to help her family improve their living standards. The main hardship that she faces is a lack of money. 

So, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to purchase home appliances for her house. She is the leader of the group and she hopes to offer her family a good life. She wants to open a savings account at the bank.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana belongs to an ultra-poor family; this is the reason she cannot afford the educational expenses of her daughter. Her husband owns a blacksmith shop in which he provides the services of welding. He also provides services in the houses of his customers. Due to an increase in iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding raw materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc., to carry on with his business.

To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise, he needs some capital to buy welding materials.
  
Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband so that he would be able to buy material to carry on with his business. 

She is the age of 32 and living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Farzana is very glad and thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Note: Farzana is standing with her hand raised in the photo.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as welding rods, soldering rods, etc., for welding work.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de 7 femmes qui font toutes du commerce. Elles habitent le même quartier et on une bonne cohésion sociale. Awa est la représentante du groupe, elle est âgée de 44 ans, marié et mère de 4 garçons de 25;22;20;et 11 ans. Et aussi de 3 filles de 23;18 et 2 ans.Elle fait du commerce dans sa domicile et avec son prêt elle compte acheter du lait à 150 000f;du poisson seché à 100 000f; du détergent et de l'eau de javel à 50 000f. Elle n'est pas la seule a mener cette activité dans son quartier mais elle a une bonne clientèle. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins sanitaires ,et scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of seven women, all of whom work as vendors. They all live in the same neighborhood and form a  close-knit team. Awa is the group’s representative. She is 44 years old and the mother of four sons, 25, 22, 20 and 11 years of age.  She also has three daughters, 23, 18, and 2 years of age. She sells out of her home. With her loan she plans to buy milk for 150,000 West African francs, dried fish for 100,000  francs, detergent and bleach for 50,000  francs. She is not the only one to run such a business in her neighborhood, but she has a good customer following. Her revenues allow her to cover healthcare and education expenses for her children.

loans.use: to buy milk for 150,000 West African francs, dry fish for 100,000 francs, and detergent and bleach for 50,000 francs.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 50 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, rice, soft drinks, cigarettes, soap and shampoo. 

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Gloria is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 37-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with three children, ages 17, 16 and 11 years old, respectively. She  engages in farming. She toils on the land and grows rice to help augment the income of their household. Her farming business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and medicines to increase her yield.  

In the future, she hopes to expand her farming business and increase the business' profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and medicines.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is a 39-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband drives a tractor and provides loading and unloading services for construction material. 

For the past many days, the tractor has not worked properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the tractor. Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the tractor. This will help him to continue his business. Zarina is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the tractor.

loans.name: Dativa

texts.en:
Dativa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and a pig fattening business. Dativa is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, snack food and school supplies for her general store business.

Dativa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, snack food and school supplies.

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
Walter de 21 años, esta soltero, no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres, quienes le han dado mucho apoyo y parte de eso es que  le dieron la oportunidad de que estudiara, así fue como aprovecho el esfuerzo de ellos, y logro terminar el bachillerato.

Desde que termino sus estudios, hace tres años, Walter se ha dedicado a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió a realizar, desde que tenia ocho años, cuando su padre lo llevaba a trabajar en las tardes, luego de que él salia de estudiar. 

El lugar donde el cultiva, esta a una distancia de 1 kilómetro y medio, se traslada en bicicleta. El trabajo lo realiza junto con su padre, y trabajan de 6 de la mañana a doce del medio día.


Walter necesita fertilizar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y es por eso necesita la ayuda del préstamo, lograra comprar los fertilizantes, para el cultivo y darle la nutrición adecuada.


Walter tiene muchos ideales, es una persona que desea superarse, es por eso que trabaja y lucha para conseguirlo. Razón de esto; es que quisiera trabajar con  ganado, también sueña con poseer su casa, para cuando se decida a formar su hogar, tener donde vivir y darle lo mejor que pueda a su familia.
texts.en:
Walter is 21 years old. He is single and doesn’t have children. He lives with his parents, who have given him a lot of support. Because of this, he was given the opportunity to go to school. So it was that he was able to make use of their efforts, and he succeeded in completing his bachelor’s degree.

Since he finished school, Walter has worked in agriculture, a job that he learned to do since he was eight years old, when his father would take him to work in the afternoons after he finished school. 

The place where he farms is 1.5 kilometers away, which he travels by bicycle. He works together with his father, and they work from 6 in the morning until 12 in the afternoon.

Walter needs to fertilize 14,000 square meters of corn, and it is for this reason that he needs the help of the loan. He will be able to buy the fertilizer for his crops and give them adequate nutrition.

Walter has many ideals. He is a person who desires to better himself, and therefore he works and fights to achieve this. The reason for this is that he wants to work with cattle. He also dreams of owning a house, so that when he decides to start a household, he will have a place to live and will give the best that he can to his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is a 23-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in a small village of Sighnaghi district. Her children go to the local school. 

The family has pigs and sells piglets. In addition, they have a small plot of land, where different types of fruits and vegetables are grown. Khatuna works as a tailor; she gets orders from home to sew different kinds of clothes. 

Khatuna decided to request a loan for purchasing a cow. The Start Up loan, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GLL (Georgia lari) for purchasing a cow. She will milk the cow every day and will start producing dairy products to sell. This will increase the income of their family, and with increased income, Khatuna will provide better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 41-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not worked properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Balqees has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Balqees is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a young hardworking man, age 26 years, hailing from the village of Kitebero in Mbarara district. He grew up without his parents after both of them died when he was very young. He was brought up by his grandmother, who also died when he was 12 years old.

He started working in people’s farms where he was looking after their banana plantations. Because of his hard work and determination, he managed to save some money, which enabled him to buy a plot and some materials for construction.

He is requesting a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to start the construction of his family house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to start the construction of his family house.

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer is a 51-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and two sons. 

Anwer requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoe maker by profession; he has been making shoes from his childhood. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession. He wants his elder son to also learn this art from him, but he is not interested in this profession.

He makes shoes by hands, and his hand-made shoes are very famous in his hometown. Previously, he provided only services to his clients for shoe making. Now, he has gotten lot of market experience, and wants to buy material on his own for shoe making so he can earn better than earlier.
 
Anwer wants to provide better facilities and education to her children and establish the business of her husband.
Anwer is very thankful to Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy raw material for making shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Yoladis

texts.es: Yoladis de 36 años de edad, madre de 2 hijos de 15 y 3 años, tiene un negocio de preparación y venta de almuerzos y servicios de buffet, para generar ingreses con los cuales sostener su hogar. Ella tomó la experiencia de su antigua empleadora donde trabajaba en la elaboración de comidas y de buffet para eventos sociales y la aprovechó para trabajar en lo mismo, por su propia cuenta desde su domicilio.  Hoy a Yoladis la contratan mucho para los eventos especiales, como matrimonios, reuniones familiares en general y actividades que incluyan almuerzos tipo buffet.  Sus principales ventas las realizan  a crédito y también de contado, comprando a proveedores ubicados en el centro de Barranquilla, donde adquiere precios competitivos en sus insumos, que le generan un mejor margen de utilidad. En la actualidad su meta principal es que mas adelante tenga un local ajustado a los requerimientos del negocio y a las condiciones que exige el manejo de alimentos, para ofrecer una mejor imagen e impactar la venta, porque planea un futuro mas prometedor para sus hijos, brindándole educación de calidad, producto de los ingresos de su negocio. Su mayor desafío es no contar con un espacio amplio, para mejorar el desempeño en su tarea, pues el lugar donde funciona es arrendado y no puede hacer adecuaciones al espacio; por eso su sueño de prosperidad es tener sus propias instalaciones, para lograr sus propósitos. Actualmente está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará arroz, por bultos, aceites, cárnicos, lácteos, para lograr atender la demanda de fin de año que se avecina y sus recursos no son suficientes, para dar respuesta a ella  y esto es justamente, lo que hace exitoso un credikiva.
texts.en:
Yolandis is 36 years old; the mother of two children, ages 15 and 3.  She has a business where she sells lunches and a buffet, in order to generate income to support her household.

She took the experience she got from her previous employer in preparing food and buffet for social events, and began working in the same field out of her home.  Now Yolandis gets hired often for special events such as weddings, family reunions, and events that include buffet lunches.

She makes most of her sales on credit and also for cash, and she buys her supplies from suppliers in Barranquilla, where she can buy at good prices and can have a better profit margin.

Now her main goal is to have a place set up for her business requirements and food management, so she can present a better image and impact her sales.  She hopes to provide  a more promising future to her children, and provide them with a quality education through the income from her business.

Her major challenge is not having a space big enough so she can better develop her tasks.  She currently works in rented space and she can't make modifications, so she hopes to have her own location.

She is asking for a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so she can buy sacks of rice, cooking oils, meats, and dairy to meet her end of year demands, now that it's approaching, and she doesn't have enough resources to cover them.  This will make her Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Jonabel

texts.en:
Jonabel is a 32-year-old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with four children.The oldest is 14 while the youngest is 4.

She engages in fishing. She catches fish, crab and sea shells to help augment the income of their household. Her business started years nine ago. She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net and crab net to improve her daily catch. In the future, she hopes to expand her fishing business and increase the business' profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and crab net.

loans.name: Dúo Kairos Group

texts.es:
DÚO KAIROS
La señora Juana quien es integrante del dúo kairos es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales 2 aun tiene a su cargo y dentro de ellos una señorita especial de 18 años ella ha demostrado ser una persona responsable honesta y sobre todo cuidadosa de mantener un muy buen record crediticio ella es propietaria de dos locales ubicados en el interior del mercado de peronia cada uno de los créditos que se le han otorgado han sido de mucho beneficio para ella y para el crecimiento de su negocio ella desea y anhela que sus negocios crezcan aun mas y esta en planes de adquirir otro local en el cual quiere invertir otro tipo de negocio(mercaderia) ella es muy beneficiada porque dentro de la comunidad y dentro del mercado es la única persona que tiene un negocio en venta de telas(materia prima) Aparte de la venta de telas ella también hace costuras cuando termina su jormada en su negocio (local) se va a su casa a elaborar costuras según la demanda que tenga de lo mismo ya que muchas personas la conocen por su creatividad y por los bajos costos que da a sus clientes, y es por eso que la señora Juana toca nuevamente las puertas de kiva para un nuevo crédito el cual quiere invertir en el mimo negocio agradeciendo de antemano por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of Dúo Kairos and the mother of six children. Two children are still dependent on her, including an 18-year-old daughter with special needs. Juana has proven to be a very responsible and honest person, and very careful in maintaining a good credit record. 

She owns two shops located inside the Market of Peronia. The loans that she has previously received have been of much help to her and to the growing of her business. She wishes for her businesses to grow even more, and she is planning to acquire another shop where she wants to sell another type of merchandise. She is very lucky because in this community and in this market she is the only person who sells unworked fabric. 

Apart from selling clothes, she also does tailor jobs. After she finishes her working day in the shop, she goes home and sews according to the current demand. Many people know her for her creativity and for the fair prices she offers her clients. This is why Juana is applying for another loan, which she will invest in this business. She gives thanks in advance for the help offered.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Kondiougou 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 3 sont des femmes toutes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Nafissa  debout en troisième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Bandiagara et de Mopti, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 55.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 3 group are all married women who are, on average, 46 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Nafissa grows onions, and she is the person standing third from the left. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level, in Bandiagara and Mopti, to men and women customers. 

Nafissa hopes to earn 55,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, health and schooling costs. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Kondiougou 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 7 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé ont été bien remboursé.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Mariama Boureima debout en deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, de Ondougou, de Bandiagara et Mopti après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 50.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 2 group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have seven children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution, and their previous loan has been repaid correctly.

Mariama Boureima grows onions and is the person standing second from the right in the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizers. After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level, in Ondougou, Bandiargara and Mopti, to men and women customers. 

Mariama Boureima hopes to earn 50,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, health, and schooling costs. She will reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Tuzokora Group

texts.fr:
Aline fait partie du groupe  Tuzokora et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a  30 ans et est mariée  à Janvier, un chauffeur. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 2 à 15 ans, dont  4 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de farine de manioc et de l’huile de palme depuis 11 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une  tonne de manioc sec,  500kg de riz  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait acheter un moulin et avoir une boutique.
texts.en:
Aline is part of the Tuzokora group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 30 years old and is married to Janvier, a driver. Together they have five children aged from 2 to 15 years, of whom four attend school.

She has been trading cassava flour and palm oil for the past 11 years.

This is her third credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan she will increase her working capital and buy a ton of dried cassava and 500 kg of rice for resale, to earn more.

In coming years, she would like to buy a mill and own a shop.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a ton of dried cassava and 500 kg of rice for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Kondiougou 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KONDIOUGOU 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  Bandiagara, 5ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités maraîchères en cette fin d’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est essentiellement l’oignon avec Mme  Anta Boureima debout en troisième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  de la semence et des engrais. La production est vendue au niveau du village, et de Bandiagara, après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000  Francs CFA en fin de campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’aider son mari dans les dépenses familiales: nourriture, scolarisation des enfants et la santé et réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Kondiougou 4 group are all married women who are, on average, 45 years old and have four children. They all live in polygamous families in Bandiagara, in the fifth administrative region of Mali. 

They are working with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their small-scale farming at the end of this rainy season. They are on their first loan with the institution.

Anta Boureima grows onions, and she is the person standing third from the right in the photo. With this loan, she plans to buy seeds and fertilizer.

After the harvest, crops are sold at the village level, and in Bandiagara, to men and women customers. 

Anta Boureima hopes to earn 25,000 francs CFA at the end of the season. These earnings will allow her to help her husband with the family expenses: food, health and schooling costs for her children. The rest will be reinvested in farming.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Dieu Beni Group

texts.fr:
Mme AÏSSATA représente le groupe DIEU BENI. Elle est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Personne ne va à l’école et elle a 01personne en charge.
Mme vend du jus depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de la ville. Ses clients sont les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  01 sac de bissaps, 01 sac de petit mil, 01 sac de sucre et 01sac de lait pour la préparation des jus.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut épargner une partie et s’acheter un congélateur. Mme ambitionne  diversifier son commerce et assurer la santé de sa mère.
texts.en:
Aissata represents the Dieu Beni group. She is single and has no children, but takes care of one person. She didn't go to school.

Aissata has been selling juice for five years. She procures the ingredients from village markets. She sells [the juice] to children.

She wants to buy one sac of bissaps [hibiscus flowers], one sac of pearl millet, one sac of sugar, and one sac of milk for her juice making.

With earnings, she wants to save some and [also] buy a freezer. Aissata aims to diversify her commerce and ensure the health of her mother.

loans.use: to buy one sac of bissap [hibiscus flower], one sac of pearl millet, one sac of sugar, and one sac of milk for juice preparation

loans.name: Mansata

texts.fr: SON BANC VILLAGEOIS D'APPARTENANCE A VU LE JOUR LE 24 MARS 2001. MADAME MANSATA 47 ANS EST UN DES MEMBRES DU GROUPE DE SOLIDARITÉ NOMME BANTERY COMPOSE DE 9 MEMBRES. ELLE EST VEUVE ET MÈRE DE 8 ENFANTS ET SA FILLE AINÉE EST ÂGÉE AUJOURD'HUI DE 30 ANS. ELLE ACHÈTE DES LÉGUMES EN FONCTION DES PÉRIODES POUR LES REVENDRE. DU FAIT DE SON EXPÉRIENCE DANS CE DOMAINE ELLE APPROUVE UN PEU DE DIFFICULTÉ PARFOIS POUR ÉCOULER SES MARCHANDISES VU LA CONCURRENCE DANS LE MARCHE ET LES BÉNÉFICES SERVENT POUR LA PRISE EN CHARGE DE LA FAMILLE : LA NOURRITURE, LA SCOLARITÉ DES ENFANTS ETC...
texts.en:
The "banc villageois" (loan association) she belongs to was founded on March 24, 2001.

Mrs. Mansata is 47 years old and a member of the Bantery solidarity group. She is a widowed mother of eight children whose eldest daughter is now 30 years old.

She buys vegetables depending on the season for retail sales. Although she is experienced in this activity, she sometimes finds it difficult to dispose of her merchandise due to competition in the marketplace.

The profits will be devoted to family needs: food, children's tuition,...

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Celestine's Group

texts.fr: CE GROUPE DE QUATRE FEMMES A EU DÉJÀ A REMBOURSER 10 PRÊTS. ELLES PRATIQUENT COMME ACTIVITÉ PRINCIPALE LE COMMERCE. LA REPRÉSENTE MADAME RELINA FATIMA EST VEUVE. ELLE EST ÂGÉE DE 32 ANS. ELLE EST MÈRE DE 5 ENFANTS DONT 3 GARÇONS. SON AINE EST AGE DE 14 ANS. ELLE VEND DES LÉGUMES TELS QUE LES OIGNONS, POIVRE, DES CAROTTES, CHOUX ETC... AU MARCHE DE SA LOCALITÉ DEPUIS PLUS DE 3 ANS. SES BÉNÉFICES LUI SERVENT A AIDER SA FAMILLE POUR LA PRISE EN CHARGE DE LA NOURRITURE, DE LA SCOLARITÉ DES ENFANTS. UNE FEMME BATTANTE ET TRÈS COURAGEUSE.
texts.en:
This group of four women has already paid back 10 loans. They all engage in commerce. 

The representative, Relina Fatima, is a 32-year-old widow. She is the mother of five children, of whom three are boys. Her eldest child is 14 years old. Relina Fatima is a [strong] fighter and very brave.

Relina Fatima has been selling vegetables, especially onions, peppers, carrots, cabbage, etc., in a local market for more than three years.

Earnings allow her to help her family with the costs of food and the children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 50-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan and is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

He is now interested in offering more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and also his savings. However, due to the lack of capital, he finds this difficult. Therefore, his wife Nasreen as a member of a four-person lending group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This is so she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruit from the field to sell in the market at a profitable price. With the profit, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Nasreen is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruit from the field to sell.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is married and has a personal products business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her three children.

Janice requested a PHP 1800 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency. Janice is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.en:
Timoteo is a farmer from the town of Trinidad, Bohol. He has been in the vegetable farming business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income.

Timoteo is asking for a loan to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides. With this, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm thus augmenting his yield and profit.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Ma. Roselyn

texts.en:
Ma. Roselyn is 37 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Roselyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from tricycle transport.

Ma. Roselyn aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Wausi

texts.en:
Wausi is 61 years old and married with four children. She does farming in Tala town where she grows vegetables to sell at the market place. She has been in the business for the last 10 years and it has been profitable.

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs for use on her farm. These include fertilizer and seeds. She will use the anticipated profits from her business to buy more farm inputs and also support her children.

This is her first loan term and her hopes and dreams in the future are to be financially stable and ensure her family lives well.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs for use.

loans.name: Kamuri Brick Makers Group

texts.en:
Kamuri Brick Makers Group is located in the district of Isingiro. The group is comprised of men whose major activity is brick making. They fall into different categories including retired civil servants and army veterans.

Degratious, aged 40, is a resident of Buhigore in Isingiro district. After his retirement from civil service, he started commercial farming in order to survive and also to cater for his family. This business grew and helped him to sustain the family and support his children's education. He later obtained a loan of 700,000 UGX from UGAFODE Microfinance which helped him to increase his business profits.

This motivated him to mobilize his colleagues to form a development group called Kamuri Brick Makers. This group is very determined to change each member’s life and has succeeded in many developmental projects but with a lot of challenges and that is why they are requesting loans. Degratious will use his loan to hire laborers to make bricks which are in high demand because so many people are doing construction these days. He expects the business to expand because there is a ready market.

loans.use: To hire laborers to make bricks

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 46 years old; he lives with his wife and his five children in Gaza. Two of his children are in primary school.
 
He has been selling clothes since 2009; he works hard to support his family and to provide good living conditions for his children. 

Hasan is asking Ryada for this loan to buy a motorcycle, this will help him to transport his goods from place to another.

Hasan is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a happy and proud mother of four. She is 52 years old and is widowed. Her children have already finished college. Her husband has passed away and to keep herself busy and felt not saddened by the event, Felicidad got engaged in managing a food-vending business in their village as her hobby. 

She cooks menus for meals and snacks as well. Felicidad wants to expand the business; that’s why she is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy bananas, meat and raw ingredients to cook with. She will be much happier seeing her business grow through the lenders' financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy bananas, meat and raw ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: Jig

texts.en:
Jig is 32 years old and single. He lives in the municipality of Clarin in Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in his business for more than five years and earns 20,000 PHP every month. 

He joined GDMPC last year, and his previous loan, used to repair his vehicle, was successfully repaid. Recently he has requested a new loan of 30,000 PHP to buy new set of tires for the vehicle he uses in his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy new set of tires for the vehicle he uses in his business.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 43 years old, married and blessed with four children aged 19, 16, 13 and two years old. He buys and sells cattle and has been in this business for 10 years.

He will be using this loan to buy more cows and goats which he will later sell at a profit. He will use the generated profits from his expanded business to provide for the needs of his family as well as repay the loan.

Having paid all his previous loans successfully, this will be his third loan term. In future, Lawrence hopes to educate his children up to tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is from Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children. Rodrigo owns and operates a farm planting and harvesting bananas for sale. He has been engaged in his business to make a living for more than seven years. 

In 2010, Rodrigo joined GDMPC and has successfully repaid his previous loans that were used on his farm. Recently, he has borrowed a new loan of 25,000 PHP to cover the costs of banana replanting for expansion.  He plans to use the additional profit generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the costs of banana replanting for expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes, green vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in Malindi, Kenya. He is 38 years old, married and with one child. He owns a gift shop in Malindi. The retail business has been running for three years now and it has been growing. He has managed to employ two people in the business to help him run the business. 

He heard of Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy Nova seats for sale in the business. He hopes that the business will grow significantly in the next five years. The major challenge in the business is the low season when sales are really low. He will use the extra income he will raise to improve his living standards and expand the business and be able to import more products for the business.

loans.use: to buy Nova seats.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en: Fred, aged 28,  has four children and two dependants from his late brother who died four years ago.  All his children and dependants are in school and depend on him for survival.  As he has such family responsibilities, Fred has resorted to serious banana farming producing many bunches of matooke (a variety of banana) each month to supply the nearby schools and hospital. This activity has made it possible for Fred to afford to pay school fees for his children and to look after the whole family. Through farming, he has also managed to build a semi-permanent house but it’s not yet finished so he wants to take out a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy paint and lime, and hire labour to complete his house

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 42 years old, married and has three children. Through patience and hard work, she was able to send her children to school. Marivic manages a general store business and sells ingredients for meals. Sometimes, she also cooks food snacks to sell. Through her earnings from the business, two of her children were fully supported in their education and have now already finished their college studies. She dreams that her eldest child will also finish college although being a bit over-age. She believes that if you have a complete formal education, "age doesn't matter". 

Together with her husband, Marivic is actively working in their business so that it becomes competitive and both give the best of customer service to gain more business clients and bigger sales. To keep the business growing and competitive, Marivic is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy various grocery items, pork and chicken meat, fish, raw vegetables and ingredients that can be offered daily.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, pork and chicken meat, fish, raw vegetables and ingredients that can be offered daily.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 36 years old, married and has six children. She runs a retail shop and has been in the business for 10 years.

She will be using this loan to boost her business by buying more stock of goods to sell. These include sugar, rice and cooking oil. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay her loan and support her family.

This is her second loan term and she paid back her previous loan successfully. Her hopes in the future are to have a wholesale shop and raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To add s stock of goods to sell.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.en:
Yolita is a mat weaver from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been in the mat weaving business for more than two years now. She also runs a small farming business.

Yolita is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, straw and dye and fertilizer for the farm. 

In the future, Yolita hopes to expand her business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, straw and dye and fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Product weaving is the primary business of Gloria. She spends most of her time doing souvenirs and other woven products like baskets, flower baskets and rattan desk organizers. She has been doing this type of business for 19 years together with her husband who is her partner. 

Due to an increase in their orders from customers, Gloria is in need of an additional capital to meet and respond immediately. In this connection, Gloria is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy materials like bamboo and varnish for the finishing touches to their products. Gloria is always aiming to satisfy her clients, thus she is trying her best to provide better output and service.

loans.use: to buy materials like bamboo and varnish for the finishing touches to their products.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane keeps poultry and also owns rental houses. She is married and is 64 years old. She has four adult children who are independent. She has been in this business for 40 years and makes a monthly income of 40,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She plans to use the loan to purchase more poultry for sale. She also plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and also save for future investments. This is her third loan term and she paid her previous loans successfully. 

She hopes to build more rental houses and buy her own car to supply her poultry products.

loans.use: To buy more poultry for sale.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family.
