Phoebe is borrowing PHP 4600 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have back-up light in case of emergency. Phoebe is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 55 years old and married with four children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. To make a living, she manages her general store while her husband works as an OFW (overseas Filippino worker). She has been doing this for four years in order to augment their living standards. 

She has been with GDMPC since the year 2010, and her previous loan which was used in her business was successfully repaid and she borrowed a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more grocery goods, biscuits and candies for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods, biscuits and candies for sale.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 44-year-old married woman. She is the mother of two children and adores her family. Riffat belongs to a poor family and they live in miserable conditions. She has a large family and it is very difficult to feed them all as her husband is the only person earning in the family and his income is inadequate to meet the family's needs.

Riffat's husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. He is a doctor and owns a small medical clinic. At present, he needs to purchase medicines for his clinic. For that, he needs additional capital as he doesn't have enough savings.

Therefore, Riffat is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. He will use the loan amount to purchase a variety of medicines so that he can respond quickly to patients' needs. Riffat hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of medicines.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in the Litein area of Kenya, which houses a campus of Mt. Kenya University. She has four children and has been doing this work for 5 years. Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Poultry.' Her biggest challenge is 'Poultry diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given no names.

Stella was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Low interest.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'They are significant for our economy.'

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Stella replied 'it will help in generating more income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stella owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, running water' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Khady's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été créé en juillet 2011,il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même village.Elles ont comme activité le petit commerce et l'agriculture.

La représentante est celle qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,elle est âgée de 49 ans,elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons.

Elle pratique le commerce d'arachides,de légumes et d'ingrédients pour repas.Notre cliente achéte en gros pour revendre au détail.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter un sac d'arachide à 10 000f,30000 f pour les achats de légumes et ingrédients tels que le poivre,de l'arôme en poudre.

Ainsi avec les bénéfices du prêt,elle compte contribuer au ravitaillement de la famille,assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et leur frais médicaux.
texts.en:
This group was established in July 2011, it is composed of members who are from the same village. Their activities are petty trade and agriculture.

The person representing the group is the one raising her arm on the right of the photo. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of seven children, including four boys.

She sells peanuts, vegetables and ingredients for meal preparations. She buys in bulk to resell at retail prices. She will use her ​​loan to buy a bag of peanuts for 10,000 francs, and use 30,000 francs to buy vegetables and ingredients such as pepper and powdered flavoring.

With the profits from the loan, she intends to contribute towards nourishing the family, and to cover her children's tuition and medical expenses.

loans.use: buy peanuts, vegetables and food ingredients such as pepper

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 57 years old, married and all her children are above 18 years old. She does farming in Kangundo town where she keeps dairy cattle as well as plants cash crops. She has been in the farming business for the last 10 years.

She will use the loan to buy a diary cow. This will enable her to have more milk to supply to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to promote her agricultural production.

This is her fitth loan term after paying back all her previous loans successfully. In future, she hopes to become a successful large-scale farmer.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 22-year-old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with an child who is one year and seven months old. Her husband works as a barber  to support their family.

She  runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items ranging from eggs, sugar, coffee, cooking oil, soap and other basic commodities. Her business started a year ago. She is asking for a loan to buy  a sack of rice and various canned goods. 

In the future, she hopes to expand her small business and increase business profitability for her child's future.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and various canned goods.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie works hard to support her family. Tessie is married and has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

Tessie is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a back-up light in case of emergency.

Tessie is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ezabell

texts.en:
Ezabell is 42 years old, married and has three children. She does greengrocery farming. She grows vegetables, tomatoes and onions to sell. She also has rental housing business. She has been in the farming business for four years now and it has been profitable. 

She plans to use the loan to expand her business by buying pesticides, fertilizers and seeds for planting. She will also use part of the amount to pay school fees for the children. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and also save. 

Having paid back her previous loans successfully, this will be her third loan term. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot and build a home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a 38-year-old woman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is married with four children ages 12, nine, seven and five years old. Her husband works as private driver  to support their family. 
 
She goes farming. She grows and sells rice to earn a living. Her business started almost two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy additional rice seedlings and fertilizers, to gain more harvest.

In the future, Felicitas hopes to expand her farming business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy additional rice seedlings and fertilizers.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah has been selling clothes for the past 10 years. She is 55 years old, married and blessed with five children. She makes a monthly income of Kenya Shillings 15,000 and it has been profitable.

This being her second loan term, she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of clothes to sell. These include blouses, skirts and t-shirts. She anticipates making more income with which she will expand her business.

Peninah hopes to grow her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman and mother of three children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than three years now with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Delia is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Delia hopes to expand their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue which is necessary for the needs of the family and to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and hooks.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine does farming at Kangundo town where she keeps cattle and plants cash crops to sell. She is 37 years old, married and has four children. She has been in this business for 12 years and her monthly income from her business is Kenya Shillings 5,000.

This will be her second loan term and Josephine will use it to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and seeds to plant. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children and repay the loan.

Josephine looks forward to buying another cow and having a bright future too.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Kamencu

texts.en:
Kamencu is 37 years old, married and has three children aged 12, six and two. She has a quarry business and she sells building blocks and stones to various constructions sites. She has been in the business for three years now.

She will be using this loan to buy another piece of land for quarrying and thereby get more building blocks to sell. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay the loan. This is her first loan term.

Her hopes and dreams in future are to expand her business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy another piece of land for quarrying.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily works hard to support her family. Emily is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emily is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend their business hours even after nightfall.

Emily is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 34 years old and married with three children, who are all in school. Leila works very hard to provide for them.

Leila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leila has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future Leila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old, married and has two children. She does tailoring and has been in the business for six years. She makes a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya Shillings. 

She plans to use the loan to purchase fabric materials for dress-making and embroidery. She hopes to make more profits with which she will use to educate her children. This is her second loan term and she paid back her previous loan successfully. 

Beatrice hopes to become successful in her business and build her own residential house.

loans.use: To buy fabric materials.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 21 years old, married to George who supports the family, and they have been blessed with a child who is one year old.

She runs a retail shop and she has been in business for two years with a monthly income of KES 20,000. Catherine is borrowing a loan of KES 20,000 in order to add stock to her retail shop. She plans to save the profit from the business for future use.

This is her first loan and her hope and dream is to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock to her business.

loans.name: Tahmina

texts.ru: Тахмина родилась в 1981 года. Она добрая и жизнерадостная женщина. Тахмина замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Тахмина всегда жила бедно, так как ее муж зарабатывал мало денег, и это не хватало для обеспечения семьи, а Тахмина занималась воспитанием детей. Она 8 месяцев назад поступила на работу. Она работает в аэропорте уборщицей. Тахмина была вынуждена найти источник дохода, так как они живут крайне бедно, но так как она не имеет высшее образование, она согласилась поступить на работу как уборщица. Она уже несколько месяцев страдает от зубной боли, но не имеет денег для лечения зубов. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 400 долларов США для лечения зубов. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tahmina was born in 1981. She is a good and cheerful woman. Tahmina is married and raising four children. Tahmina has always lived in poverty, as her husband earned very little money. It was not enough to provide for the family, and Tahmina only worked with raising the children. 

Eight months ago, Tahmina started working. She works at the airport as a cleaning lady. Tahmina was forced to find a source of income, as they lived very poorly, but as she does not have higher education, she agreed to start working as a cleaner. 

Tahmina has been suffering from toothache for some months, but she does not have the money for dental treatment. She requests a loan in the amount of 400 US dollar for the treatment of her teeth. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for treatment of her teeth

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from ten to 18 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a town centre and her primary customers are retailers, hotels, schools etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that at times supply of eggs is low. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more eggs for resale. Her business goal is to open a firm within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will meet her family's demands. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and put some as savings. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more eggs for resale.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 69 years old and married with one kid.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norma has been farming rice for ten years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is married with an only child and resides in Malaubang, Ozamiz City with his family. His wife works as an agent for a private insurance company while he has a business buying and selling varieties of fish for household aquariums. He is newly engaged in this line of business. 

He borrowed 25,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit to purchase additional varieties of fingerlings (little fish) to resell. He is hopeful that through this business, he could combine the business of having fish in their aquarium for decoration and for business. In the future, he plans to repair his house using the returns from his investments.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of fingerlings to resell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 59 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from tricycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 52-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Getafe, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now together with her husband. She is also into a hog-raising business. These are the sources of their income. Lucia is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, nylon and other things as well as additional piglets to raise and animal feed. With this, they will be able to improve their fishing business as well as their hog-raising venture and augment their income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and nylon as well as additional piglets to raise and animal feed.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a dressmaker from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than 15 years now. Esterlita is a married woman and has six children. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Esterlita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters for the fishing business. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Esterlita hopes to expand her business as well as their fishing venture.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters for the fishing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a dairy unit.

loans.name: Roxana Beatríz

texts.es:
Roxana es una joven de 20 años, esta acompañada, tiene una niña de dos años. Su esposo trabaja en un taller de estructuras metálicas. Roxana actualmente estudia el bachillerato a distancia, todos los sábados asiste al instituto para terminar la educación media.

Ella posee una pequeña tienda y venta de ropa. Son las únicas actividades con las que cuenta, para tener ingresos, y ayudar con los gastos de la casa a su esposo. Decidió iniciar este negocio hace tres años, y con mucho sacrificio a podido mantenerlo todo este tiempo, a pesar que ha tenido que pasar por una enfermedad, en la cual a tenido que gastar los ahorros del negocio para su tratamiento. Dicho negocio lo tiene en su casa, sus horarios son de cuatro de la mañana a nueve de la noche.

El préstamo sera de gran ayuda para Roxana, ya que desea elaborar flores artificiales, debido a que el 2 de noviembre se celebra en nuestro país, el día de los fieles difuntos, y para esa fecha, ella elabora este tipo de flores, pero a causa de la enfermedad que padecía, no tenia fondos para invertirlos en el negocio. Con el prestamos se podrá ayudar a que ella pueda trabajar en el negocio de las flores artificiales.

Roxana es una persona con deseos de superación, y eso la mueve para que ella desee terminar sus estudios de educación media, y si todo sale como ella lo tiene planificado, poder hacer un préstamo y continuar estudiando en educación superior, y de su negocio ir cancelando las cuotas. Como madre piensa en su hija, y ayudarle para que sea una persona honesta y responsable, y que logre triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Roxana is 20 years old, married and has a two-year-old girl. Her husband works in a metal structures workshop. Roxana is currently studying high school through distance learning, every saturday going to the institute in person in order to finish her secondary education.

She owns a small shop and sells clothing. These are her only income generating activities, which she uses to help her husband with their home expenses. She decided to start with this business three years ago, and despite some hardship she has been able to maintain it throughout this time. She fell ill in the past and had to use her savings from her work to pay for the treatment. Her shop is at her home, and its opening hours are from 4 am to 9 pm.

The loan will be a great help to Roxana. She wants to craft artificial flowers because on the 2nd of November the Commemoration of All Faithful Departed is observed in her country. She makes all sorts of flowers for this date, but due to her previous illness she had no funds to invest in her business. This loan will help her to work on her artificial flower business.

Roxana is a person with a desire to grow, which pushes her to want to finish her secondary education, and if everything goes according to plan, she will ask for a loan to continue with higher education, paying it with the income from her business. As a mother she thinks of her child, and she wishes to help her to be a honest and responsible person, as well as to succeed in life.

loans.use: to make artificial flowers

loans.name: Ainura

texts.ru: Айнуре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Айнуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айнура занимается животноводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айнуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 2 лошади, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айнура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Ainura is 39 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Ainura has secondary education. As a source of income for her family, Ainura works with livestock breeding, after having started 16 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Ainura's persistent work, her farm has one dairy cow, one calf, two horses and twenty sheep today. The monthly income is 19,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Ainura turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase heifers to increase the number of livestock. Ainura plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for building a new cattle barn.

loans.use: to purchase heifers

loans.name: Chigit

texts.ru: Чигит житель села города Вахдат. Ему 56 лет. Он заместитель директора сельской школы. Большую часть своей жизни он проработал в школе своего села. Сейчас он заботится о своем будущем и будущем жены, так как через определенное время ему выходить на пенсию. Поэтому Чигит и его жена решили на старости лет заняться скотоводством. У Чигита есть коровник размером 6х4 метров и сено. На сумму своего сбережения он купил уже одного бычка. Он просит кредит, чтобы закупить еще двух бычков и начать свой бизнес. Он собирается откармливать скот в течение одного месяца и затем перепродать на местном скотном рынке. На полученную сумму от продажи скота он планирует закупить уже 4-х молодых бычков и таким образом расшириться.
texts.en:
Chigit is a resident of a village near the city of Vahdat. He is 56 years old. He is a deputy director of the village school. For the largest part of his live he has worked at the school in his village. 

Currently Chigit is concerned with his and his wife's future, as he will go on a pension in a few years. Therefore Chigit and his wife decided that in their old age they would work with livestock breeding. 

Chigit has hay and a cattle barn of size 6x4 meters. With his savings he bought a bull already. He requests a loan in order to purchase two additional bulls and start his business. He will fatten the cattle for a period of a month and then resell them at the local cattle market. For the sum he receives from the sale, he plans to purchase four more young bulls and this way expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase two young bulls to start a cattle sales business

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Berta de 60 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, quienes están casados y tienen su hogar.  Ella esta soltera, y viven dos nietos con ella. Doña berta no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que sus padres no le dieron esa oportunidad.

Ella se dedica al negocio de venta de tortillas y tiene 25 años de estar trabajando en esta actividad. Oficio que aprendió de su madre, desde que tenia ocho años de edad. El negocio lo tiene en su casa, donde todos los días, hace dos turnos para vender, en la medio día y en la tarde, que son las horas en que los clientes se acercan para comprar el producto.


Doña Berta, necesita continuar trabajando en el negocio, ya que hace un mes enfermo y gasto lo que tenia para invertirlo en el negocio. Por lo que, con la ayuda del crédito,  comprara maíz, leña y cal. De esta forma se contribuye a que ella, pueda tener ingresos para su alimentación y gastos personales.

Su sueño, es poder ampliar su negocio, también le gustaría mejorar su vivienda y las ganancias que persiva, las utilizara, para cancelar el crédito e intentar cumplir sus sueños. Sabe que todo esto, podrá lograrlo con su esfuerzo y con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Berta is 60 years old and has two children, who are married and have their own homes. She is single but lives together with two of her grandchildren. Berta did not have the opportunity to study because it was not given to her by her parents.

She makes a living through the sale of tortillas, which she has been doing for 25 years. This is something she learned from her mother when she was 8 years old. She operates this business from her home, where she sells tortillas in two shifts, at noon and in the afternoon, which are the times in which customers approach her to buy the product.

Berta needs to continue working on the business since she fell ill one month ago and spent her savings to invest in her business. She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, which will help her to buy food and for personal expenses.

Her dream is to be able to expand her business. She would also like to improve her home. She will use her income to repay her loan and to try to achieve her dreams. She knows that she will be able to achieve all this through her effort and helped by the loans.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime for the preparation of tortillas

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen, aged 34, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She purchases clothes at cheap rates with the help of her husband and sells them in her locality. Parveen has been doing this since 2010, and now has enough experience and knows the clothes dealing business very well.

Parveen wants to utilize her clothing experience and earn more profit but she is compelled to take out a loan due to her low financial conditions. Owing to the Eid Festival, the demand for clothing also increases.
 
Therefore, Parveen has shown her interest in taking out a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can buy a variety of clothes to sell. She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and that she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide better facilities and living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Umed

texts.ru: Умед энергичный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он учится в университете. Умед с детства мечтал стать программистом и с такой целью он учился в школе отлично. Умед для того, чтобы реализовать свою мечту в реальность в этом году поступил в Политехнический Университет в факультет Программирование и информационная технология. Умед является одним из находчивых студентов и с уроками справляется отлично. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Umed is an energetic young man. He is 18 years old. He studies at the university. Umed has dreamed of becoming a programmer since childhood and with this aim he studied well in school. 

This year Umed entered the faculty of Programming and Information Technology at the Polytechnic University, in order to realize his dream. Umed is one of the most resourceful students and copes really well with the lectures. He requests a loan to pay for his tuition. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his education

loans.name: Maftuna

texts.ru:
В одном доме живут Мафтуна с 5 летним ребенком и ее брат с женой. Мафтуне 32 года, разведена. Последние два года она занимается продажей легкой женской одежды, халатов и нижнего белья на центральном рынке города Конибодом. Когда она на работе за ее ребенком следит жена брата. Брат Мафтуны тоже занимается торговлей. Мафтуна развелась с мужем, уже имея ребенка. Ей приходится самой обеспечивать себя и сына, так как муж не помогает им в финансовом отношении. 
Для развития торговли сейчас Мафтуне необходимо закупить новый товар. Скоро зима и люди будут покупать исключительно теплые вещи. По этой причине она нуждается в кредите. Мафтуна на деньги от кредита хочет приобрести товар зимней одежды, что способствует увеличению спроса на товар.
texts.en:
Maftuna and her five year old child live together with her brother and his wife in one house. Maftuna is 32 years old and divorced. The last two years she has worked with selling light women's clothing, gowns and underwear at the central market of the village of Konibodom. When she is at work her brother's wife looks after her child. Maftuna's brother also works with sales. Maftuna had already gotten the baby when she divorced from her husband. She has to provide for herself and her son alone, as her ex-husband does not help them with financially. 

To develop her sales, Maftuna currently needs to purchase new goods. Winter is soon here, and people are starting to only purchase warm clothes. For this reason Maftuna needs a loan. She would like to purchase winter clothing for the loan, as this will increase demand for her goods.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for selling

loans.name: Gavharbiby

texts.ru: Гавхарбиби 47 лет. Она пережила много трудностей в жизни. Ее муж умер в 1998 года. Она осталась с 2 детьми. Благодаря своему образованию, она смогла найти работу и обеспечить себя и своих детей. Она уже много лет работает в библиотеке. Она библиотекарь. Гавхарбиби полученную зарплату использует для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью продуктами питания. Она постепенно улучшает условию проживания. Гавхарбиби хочет купить мебель для своих детей, но не имеет достаточно денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 850 долларов США для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gavharbiby is 47 years old. She lived through many difficulties in her life. Her husband died in 1998. She was left with two children. Thanks to her education, she was able to find work and support herself and her children. She has worked at a library for many years already. She is a librarian. 

Gavharbiby spends the income she receives to provide her family with food products. She gradually improves their living conditions. Gavharbiby would like to purchase furniture for her children, but does not have enough money. She requests a loan in the amount of 850 US dollar to purchase furniture. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her household

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 42-year-old woman from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is married with one child aged 13 years. Her husband works as a bookkeeper for a private company to support their family.
 
She runs a sari-sari (variety store). She sells various item ranging from shampoo, noodles, canned goods, biscuits, cooking oil, and coffee. Her business started more than two years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of toiletries, beverages, seasonings, and detergents to attract more customers.

In the future, she hopes to expand her retail store to increase profitability to support her child’s education.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of toiletries, beverages, seasonings and detergents for her general store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that during the rainy season, getting charcoal to sell is a problem. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more charcoal. Her business goal is to open a chain of stores to sell charcoal within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and put some aside as savings. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is 36-years-old and married. They have been blessed with three children of the following ages: 13, eight and two years.

Rashid runs a butchery and he has been in this business for seven years. Right now his monthly income from the business is KES 15,000. He is borrowing a loan of KES 15,000 in order to boost his business. This is his first loan; his hopes and dreams are to grow his butcher shop.

loans.use: to boost his butchery business.

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira de 69 años, estudio nada más hasta el segundo grado, ya que menciona que en ese tiempo sus padres decían que el estudio no era importante y se dedicó a los quehaceres del hogar, se divorció de su esposo hace ya más de diez años,  tiene tres hijos, los tres ya están casados, pero un hijo tiene casa en el mismo terreno donde. 

Ella posee un negocio de venta de diversos tipos de productos tales como: ropa, huacales, productos de aluminio, etc, desde hace mas de 40 años de estar en el negocio, se dedicó por iniciativa propia para generar ingresos extras en el hogar, ella vende de casa en casa y además va tres días a vender a una isla, en la cual se va tres días y por la distancia se queda ahí donde unos familiares. 

El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de más mercadería para el negocio, quiere comprar artículos de limpieza como: escobas, trapeadores, cepillos, y comprar más ropa, ya que esta generando mas clientela y tiene mas demanda de productos.

A futuro ella quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio, ya que menciona que por su edad,  no le va ha ser posible seguir vendiendo de casa en casa,  así que planea conseguir un local para instalar un negocio fijo y seguir teniendo ingresos para subsistir.
texts.en:
Edelmira is 69 and divorced from her husband for over ten years. She is the mother of three adult children, all married, one of whom lives nearby. Edelmira has only a second-grade education because when she was a child, her parents said that education wasn't important. Edelmira therefore stayed home helping manage the family's home. 

Over 40 years ago, Edelmira started a business selling clothing, wood and aluminum products, and various other goods in order to generate additional income for her family. She sells her goods door to door and goes to an island where some relatives live to sell to people there, staying on the island three days each week because it's so far from her home.      

Edelmira will use funds from this loan to purchase more merchandise for the business, including cleaning products such as brooms, mops, brushes, and more clothing. The business is generating more customers and demand for products is growing. 

Edelmira hopes to keep the business growing in the future and notes that given her age it won't be possible to keep selling door to door. She therefore plans to set up a shop where she can run the business and maintain a regular income.

loans.use: to purchase cleaning items such as brooms, mops, and brushes and more clothing, as her business is gaining more customers and higher demand for products.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.en: Lucio earns a living through his sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people near his place in Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of his income. Lucio is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and beverages, soap and toiletries. With this, he will be able to improve the variety of his stocks thus attracting more buyers in his store. In the future, Lucio hopes to make his business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, noodles, sugar, coffee and beverages, soap, and toiletries for his retail shop.

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
This is Rochelle, 31, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Roldan, an employee and they have a child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income continually for their everyday expenses and her child’s studies.

Rochelle operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy candy and toy products from wholesalers she repacks them and sells them with a little profit. Her products are assorted candies, toys and other products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory.

Rochelle dreams that her business will continue to grow and expand and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of candies and toy products to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is a married woman and has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself to be talkative.

She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, cabbages and spinach. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost her business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of tomatoes, cabbages and spinach for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business to other places within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to meet customer demands. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and put some as savings. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of tomatoes, cabbages and spinach for resale

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 25 years old, married to Beatrice and they have one child.

He has an electronic business in Naivasha, which he has been running for five years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd. to enable him to purchase stock of electronic appliances. With the anticipated profits, he plans to pay school fees.

Shadrack hopes to improve his family's living standards in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of electronic appliances

loans.name: Analee

texts.en:
Analee is 37 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Analee has a business selling dry goods in the Philippines. Analee requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like slippers, belts, accessories and school supplies.

Analee has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Analee would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like slippers, belts, accessories and school supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 25-year-old single woman. She has one child who is 10 years old. She describes herself to be goal oriented.

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes, basins and other household items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a business-oriented area and her primary customers are the general public.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to add stock of clothes, basins and other household items for resale. Her business goal is to open other outlets within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes, basins and other household items for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de una familia humilde, es estudiante y trabaja, quiere poder terminar su carrera y es por eso que se está esforzando mucho, ella es una persona que lucha cada día.
La carrera que está estudiando es la de enfermería, y con ello quiere poder ayudar a las personas en su salud. Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y así seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from a humble family. She is a student and she works. She wants to be able to finish her degree and that she why she is working very hard. She is a person who is a fighter every day.

Her major is nursing, and with it she wants to help people with their health. She is asking for this loan to invest in paying for her tuition and keep going to school as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: María Lourdes

texts.es:
María de 37 años, estudio su bachillerato comercial, a los 23 años decidió casarse con ahora su esposo, con el cual ya lleva 14 años de matrimonio, ambos tienen un negocio de tramitaciones aduanales en la frontera, en el cual ambos trabajan en el negocio mas una empleada, ya que cuentan con dos oficinas, actualmente sus hijos están estudiando ( 13 y 10 años de edad).


llevan 17 años de experiencia en el negocio, a los 20 años ella decidió aprender el negocio con un familiar y después de tres años de trabajar, ya tenía sus propios clientes y decidió independizarse y ya junto a su esposo decidieron poner su negocio que ha ido.

El préstamo será utilizado,  para el mejoramiento de los locales donde se encuentran los negocios y planea invertir en un negocio nuevo. 


A futuro, quiere que sus hijos se preparen académicamente, que culminen sus estudios universitarios que se conviertan en unos profesionales, y en cuanto al negocio quiere tener más oficinas y así generar empleo en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old. She studied business and at 23 decided to marry her husband. They have been married for 14 years. They have a business processing paperwork for customs at the border. They both work in the business with one employee. They have two offices. Their children are in school and are 13 and 10 years old.

They have 17 years of experience in the business. When she was 20, she decided to learn the business with a relative and after working for three years, she had her own clients and decided to go off on her own. She and her husband opened their own business. 

The loan will be used to make some improvements on the business locales, and she  plans on investing in a new business.  

In the future, she wants her children to get an education, graduate from college and have good careers. For the business, she wants to open more offices and generate more employment in her community.

loans.use: to make some improvements om the locales where she has her businesses and to invest in a new business.

loans.name: Renzo

texts.es:
Renzo tiene 26 años de edad, está en el 4to semestre de la carrera de Comercio Internacional, vive en casa de su suegra con su pareja, ellos se dedican  a la venta de ropas y calzados, quiere ser un profesional independiente para lograr un ingreso fijo para mantener a su familia ya que su pareja está embarazada. Piensa seguir trabajando  y estudiando como lo viene haciendo, ya que es una persona muy sacrificada.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas y así seguir con sus estudios y estar más cerca de su meta.
texts.en: Renzo is 26 years old. He is in hie 4th semester of his major of International Business. He lives in his mother in law's house with his spouse. They work selling clothes and shoes. He wants to be an independent businessman in order to have a stable income to support his family, since his wife is pregnant.  He plans to continue working as he has been doing, since he is a very hardworking person. He is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in paying for his tuition and continuing with his education to come closer to meeting his goal.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El Sr. Cesar es empleado de la Empresa, es estudiante, también es estudiante de la carrera de Administración de empresas, comenta que tiene como meta terminar sus estudios y llegar a administrar alguna empresa grande, su aspiración es llegar a ser un profesión destacado, y ayudar a la gente desde su profesión.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, para que de esa manera siga cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de la universidad y siga estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Cesar is employed at a business, and is also a student. He studies business administration. He says that that the goals he has set for himself include finishing his studies and managing some large business. He aspires to become an outstanding professional, and help people with his profession.

He is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the payment of his university fees, so that he can continue meeting his university obligations and studying. He is thankful to be receiving this opportunity to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella está estudiando una especialización en didáctica universitaria, quiere poder aumentar sus conocimientos para poder ayudar a las personas que al igual que ella quiere estudiar.
Ella es una persona que quiere ser una buena profesional para poder servir también a las demás personas por medio su estudio.
Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas y así seguir con su meta de estudiar y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Clara is from the city of Pilar.  She is majoring in education at the university.  She wants to increase her knowledge so that she can help people who want to learn like she does.  She wants to be a good professional so she can serve everyone else with her studies.

She is requesting this loan to pay her fees so that she can continue with her goal of studying and being someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis tiene 27 años vive en la casa de su hermana,  trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes va a la Facultad.
Está en el último año de la carrera de Licenciatura en Química, y una vez  que termine su carrera su sueño es tener una industria, donde pueda aplicar todo lo que aprendió por medio de sus estudios.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en el pago de un trabajo, ya que tiene muchos gastos y quiere poder cubrirlo para terminarlo a tiempo.
texts.en:
Luis is 27 years old and lives in his sister's home.  He works in the morning and goes to university in the afternoon.  He is in his last year of his bachelor's degree in Chemistry.  Once he finishes his studies, he hopes to have a business where he can apply everything he learned during his studies.

He is requesting this loan to pay for research work since he has many expenses and wants to be able to pay them so he can finish on time.

loans.use: to pay for research work.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is a married woman and mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol. She has engaged in a fishing business for more than 20 years now with her husband. This is the source of their income.
Ma. Glenda is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fish hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Ma. Glenda hopes of making their fishing business a success and a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters and fish hooks

loans.name: Cecily

texts.en: Cecily is 40 years old and is married. She has two children. She sells grocery items, such as vegetables, bananas, tomatoes and carrots. In addition, Cecily sells rice. She has been in this business for three years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES (Kenya Shillings). Cecily plans to use the loan to buy more rice to sell, as a way of expanding her business. She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and to  save. This is her second loan, after repaying her previous loan successfully. Cecily hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.

loans.use: to buy more rice to sell.

loans.name: Merioth

texts.en: Merioth is a 31-year-old single woman. She has two children, ages 5 and 12. She describes herself as goal-oriented. She operates an electronics store where she sells television sets, radios and other electronics. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a market area, and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add more stock of television sets, radios and other electronics. Her business goal is to open more branches to maximize profits, within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her third loan from SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 60,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to increase her stock of television sets, radios and other electronics.

loans.name: Kimunyu

texts.en: Kimunyu is 37 years old, married to Ann, and they have two children who are in school. He has a retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for eighteen years, and he also has a hotel business. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd to enable him buy maize flour, rice, sugar and other items. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy more stock for his shop and his hotel. In the near future, he hopes to expand his retail shop to wholesale, and he also plans to expand his hotel to give better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, and other items to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 29 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have one child. He has a money-transfer business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has operated for three years, and he also has a general store. He has applied for his first loan from KADET Ltd, to enable him to increase his M-Pesa float, and he plans to plow the anticipated profits back into his business. He hopes to apply for a bigger loan from KADET Ltd to boost his business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to increase the float in his M-Pesa money-transfer business.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
Alba es estudiante, está cursando el segundo año de la carrera de Técnico superior en radiología, su mayor aspiración es ser una profesional exitosa y ejercer su profesión en su ciudad natal para poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, ya que quiere salir adelante y ser una excelente profesional. solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en pagar sus clases, y así cumplir con las obligaciones que tiene y seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Alba is a student who is in her second year of studies for a superior technical degree in radiology. Her greatest aspiration is to be a successful professional and exercise her profession in her home town in order to be able to help other people.

She is very dedicated to her studies because she wants to get ahead and be an excellent professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay for her classes, and that way, she will be able to meet her obligations and keep studying.

loans.use: to pay for university classes

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
Nueva vida está en su segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación en la que cada una se encuentra y asi seguir trabajando por mejorar sus ingresos.
Luz es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y también lencería. Comenta que trabaja arduamente para poder mejorar su vida y la de su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y que quiere progresar. Solicita de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, como ser lencería, remeras, jeans y demás, y con ello poder surtirse y dar a su clientela lo que pide, además poder ir mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Nueva Vida is in their second cycle with the female entrepreneurs program.  They are also participating in the poverty elimination survey in order to know the situation that each of them find themselves in, so that they can continue working to improve their incomes.  

Luz is one of the group members.  She works selling clothing of all types and lingerie.  She says that she works hard so be able to improve her family's life.  She is a very hardworking person who wants to make progress.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase clothing such as lingerie, tee shirts, jeans, and other items.  She will use these items to stock up and give her customers what they want so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as lingerie, tee shirts, jeans, and more.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
Rosa Mistica es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  está en su ciclo número seis del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante., son mujeres jefas de familia, que se están esforzando por salir adelante y dar a sus familias todo lo que pueden y ellas no tuvieron.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Lucia, quien tiene una panadería en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es muy luchadora y está esforzándose por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, sal y demás, para poder seguir haciendo sus panificados y cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa Mistica is from the city of San Lorenzo.  They are in their sixth cycle of the women's committee program where they all work and help each other to move forward.  They are female heads of household who are making an effort to succeed and give their families everything they can and that they did not have.

One of the group members is Lucia.  She has a bakery where she works every day from the early hours of the morning.  She is a fighter who is making an effort to succeed and help her family with her work.

She is requesting this loan to purchase flour, yeast, butter, salt, and other ingredients to continue making bread to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase flour, yeast, butter, salt, and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 51-year-old married woman with three children ranging from 10 to 24 years old. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring shop where she repairs and makes new clothing. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are the general public. Hellen describes herself as future-oriented. She has successfully repaid her previous 10,000 KES loan from SMEP DTM. 

Hellen is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more material, such as thread and cloth, to make new clothing. Her business goal is to increase her sales and turnover within five years. In the future, Hellen hopes to sustain her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more material, such as thread and cloth, to make new clothing

loans.name: Margareta

texts.en:
Margareta is a 23-year-old single woman. A year ago, she began a business renting Play Station games from her house. Margareta started a business breeding pigs at the same time. She started her business with 600,000 IDR that she saved to buy the pig.

Margareta is requesting a 3,000,000 IDR loan from TLM to buy two pigs and a Play Station unit. She hopes her businesses will go well so that she will be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and a Play Station unit

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en: Eunia is 38 years old, married to Gedeon and the mother of two children, ages seven and two. She has a posho mill business in Naivasha, which she has operated for the past ten years. Eunia has applied for her first loan from KADET to enable her to buy bags of maize. With the anticipated profits, she plans to expand her business. In the near future, she hopes to see her family needs fulfilled.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 45-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns an unstitched garment business, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs additional capital for the growth of the business. For that reason, Rubina is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a variety of clothes to sell, in order to  respond quickly to customer needs. He will put aside some of his profits to pay for the electricity and gas bills. Rubina hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase variety of clothes for her husband to sell.
